page.title: 18BLACKFORD HILL EDINBURGH
page.content: Three kilometres south of Edinburgh city centre, an outcrop of igneous rock forms Blackford Hill. Standing 164m high, with a{pond}at the base, it provides splendid outdoor facilities. Many varieties of ducks nest at the pond. Nearby are situated well used allotments. On the south side there is {rockclimbing}on the side of an old quarry and at Corbies Crag, a natural crag.These faces are only suitable for practice.An old quarry now houses the Region's Road Works Depot. {Joggers}and nature trail followers also use this area. 83% of users are dog walkers. A smaller number of visitors go round the{Royal Observatory}near the top. There is also a radio communications station but no one really knows what it does !
